cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: just west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then north-northeast, crossing north-central Florida on Wednesday, then tracking up the Southeast U.S. coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic late Thursday–Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of St. Marys River, FL to South Santee River, SC (no active watch for Virginia at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys and west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida, Georgia coast, South and North Carolina coasts, Mid-Atlantic coast including southeast Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (11%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts late Thursday into early Friday; most likely sustained 20–30 kt with higher gusts in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port based on current NHC surge forecast (focus remains along Florida Gulf Coast).
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated pockets up to 5 inches Thursday night–Friday; could produce brief flash/urban flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat could extend into far southeast Virginia Thursday; rough seas and short-period swell may disrupt vessel scheduling.
